feed.title: SAP Community - API Management
feed.subtitle: API Management Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Real Estate Contract management: How to maintain Notes
entry.content:
Problem Statement - Want to create or update Notes for real estate contract for each node like posting term, conditions etc.

Business Scenario:  We want to build a custom utility to create or update the Memo or Notes section of real estate contract using ABAP on S4 HANA Public cloud

Expected Solution - Solution to create or edit memo/notes long text fields on real estate contract

Please let us know if there is a way in SAP CLM Cloud version where we can create or edit memo/notes.

SAP Real Estate Management SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition SAP Sourcing and SAP Contract Lifecycle Management

entry.title: LMS Expert! Please guide - Scheduled offerings Question
entry.content: I am working on retrieving all scheduled offerings from SF LMS. I found the following API, but it requires an instructorID as input: /learning/odatav4/public/admin/scheduledoffering-service/v1/ScheduledToTeachClasses?$filter=sttcCriteria/fromDate eq 1756473000000 and sttcCriteria/toDate eq 1856498200000 and sttcCriteria/instructorID eq 'instructorID' &expand=segments($select=*)&$select=* The challenge is that to get all scheduled offerings, I would need to call this API for every instructorID. However, I haven‚Äôt been able to find any API that provides a list of instructorIDs. Has anyone come across a way to retrieve instructorIDs, or is there an alternative approach to get all scheduled offerings without filtering by instructorID?

entry.title: Best Practices for Enforcing API Governance for Applications Co-located with S/4HANA in Same Cloud I
entry.content:
I have an architectural question regarding API governance and security:

Current Scenario:

  • S/4HANA On-Premise system deployed in AWS cloud infrastructure
  • External applications accessing S/4HANA On-Premise OData/APIs are properly governed through:
    • SAP Cloud Connector (for BTP applications)
    • API Management (for external platform applications)

Challenge: Applications deployed in the same AWS infrastructure as S/4HANA On-Premise can potentially access the OData services/APIs directly, bypassing any API governance layer. This creates a security and governance gap. 

 Questions:

  1. What are the recommended approaches to ensure all API access to S/4HANA On-Premise is properly governed, even for co-located applications?
  2. Are there any reference architectures or best practices for implementing API governance within the same cloud infrastructure
  3. How can we enforce the use of API Management or similar governance layer for applications in the same network?

    Any guidance, documentation links, or reference architectures would be greatly appreciated.

    Thanks in advance !


    [Attached simplified architecture diagram showing the scenario]

entry.title: Will people still able to access my iflow even after I expose via API Management's Proxy?
entry.content:
Hi,

API management's Proxy is able to discover CI iflow and act as a layer and adding a security that can be implemented via some API policies (access control, etc). Therefore, we are exposing the API proxy's URL instead of the iflow endpoint's URL.

However, if someone knows the iflow endpoint's URL, does that mean the person can bypass the API proxy and access the iflow directly?

 

Thank you.

entry.title: How To CheckIn URL Attachment with API_CV_ATTACHMENT_SRV CreateUrlAsAttachment
entry.content:
Hi All, 

With this API I can successfully create URL Original in the Document Info Record, However that created URL Original is not checked In, How to do CheckIn with this API ? I dont see any parameter in this API to do CheckIn ? Is there any Other API which could do CheckIn as well ?

Enclosed the Successful Call with which the URL Original was created.

https://server:44300/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_CV_ATTACHMENT_SRV/CreateUrlAsAttachment?BusinessObjectTypeName='DRAW'&LinkedSAPObjectKey='ART000000000000005000000002701000'&Url='https://test.com'&UrlDescription='Link'&MIMEType='text/url'

As it can be seen in the Screenshot below, the Original was not locked, which means it is not checked In. 

Any Hint, how can i achieve this Lock along with the creation of the URL attachment.

 

 

BR,

Ketan

entry.title: OData API Reference for Phone Numbers in SuccessFactors
entry.content:
Hello Experts

I am looking for an OData API Reference currently available in SAP SuccessFactors. I am planning to create an integration for which I need to know the structure of the employee phone record in SuccessFactors. For this I am in need of a reference as to what is currently available in OData API for phone numbers.

Please suggest where can I get the documentation / reference for OData API for phone numbers.

Thanks in advance

Arul

entry.title: Provision of Sales Cloud V2 APIs via Integration Suite and Cloud Connector for on-prem clients
entry.content:
Dear colleagues,

As part of our ongoing platform transformation, we are migrating to Sales Cloud V2 and S/4HANA. Initial testing within our sandbox environment has confirmed successful access to the Sales Cloud V2 APIs.

For productive use, we aim to establish a secure and scalable integration architecture by leveraging SAP Integration Suite in conjunction with the Cloud Connector. This setup is intended to enable on-premise clients to proactively consume Sales Cloud V2 APIs.

The envisioned scenario involves external calls initiated from on-prem systems, with responses returned from the cloud ‚Äî for example, accessing data related to the Business Partner object.

We would like to validate whether this architecture is technically feasible and aligns with best practices for hybrid connectivity and secure API exposure.

entry.title: API Call API_MAINTAINANCEORDER ends with HTTP RC 423 and message "Billable Order 4001380 is not sup
entry.content:
In SAP Note 3330419 (3330419 - Release-Informationen und -Einschr√§nkungen in Bezug auf SAP S/4HANA Service - SAP for Me )  is described that for if you flag a maintenance order as billable 

is described that ar least with S/4HANA Service 2023 FPS3 it is not possible to create or change a billable flagged maintainance order via API.

Are they any plans in the SAP roadmap to enhance the API to make it possible ?

entry.title: SAP B1 10.0 FP2105 DI API ProductionOrderType always 'S'
entry.content:
private void AddProcessToSAP(ProductionOrderDTO process, SAPbobsCOM.Company company)
{
SAPbobsCOM.Recordset recordSet = (SAPbobsCOM.Recordset)company.GetBusinessObject(SAPbobsCOM.BoObjectTypes.BoRecordset);
recordSet.DoQuery($"SELECT TOP 1 DocEntry FROM OWOR WHERE Comments like '%{process.UserKey}%'");
if (recordSet.EoF) 
{
SAPbobsCOM.ProductionOrders productionOrder = (SAPbobsCOM.ProductionOrders)company.GetBusinessObject(SAPbobsCOM.BoObjectTypes.oProductionOrders);

SAPbobsCOM.Items item = (SAPbobsCOM.Items)company.GetBusinessObject(SAPbobsCOM.BoObjectTypes.oItems);
if (item.GetByKey(process.Material))
{
DateTime dtStartDate;
DateTime dtDeadLine;
productionOrder.ProductionOrderType = SAPbobsCOM.BoProductionOrderTypeEnum.bopotStandard;
productionOrder.ItemNo = process.Material;
productionOrder.PlannedQuantity = process.PlannedQuantity;
if (DateTime.TryParse(process.StartDate, out dtStartDate) == true)
{
productionOrder.PostingDate = dtStartDate;
}

if (DateTime.TryParse(process.Deadline, out dtDeadLine) == true)
{
productionOrder.DueDate = dtDeadLine;
}

productionOrder.ProductionOrderStatus = SAPbobsCOM.BoProductionOrderStatusEnum.boposPlanned;
productionOrder.Remarks = process.UserKey + " " + process.Remarks;
if (productionOrder.Add() != 0)
{
Console.WriteLine($"Error adding productionOrder: {company.GetLastErrorDescription()}");
}

}
}
else
{
DateTime dtDeadLine;
string docEntry = recordSet.Fields.Item("DocEntry").Value.ToString();

SAPbobsCOM.ProductionOrders productionOrder =
(SAPbobsCOM.ProductionOrders)company.GetBusinessObject(SAPbobsCOM.BoObjectTypes.oProductionOrders);

if (productionOrder.GetByKey(int.Parse(docEntry))) 
{
bool bChanged = false;
if (DateTime.TryParse(process.Deadline, out dtDeadLine) == true)
{
if (productionOrder.DueDate != dtDeadLine)
{
bChanged = true;
productionOrder.DueDate = dtDeadLine;
}
}

switch (process.Status)
{
case "PLANNED":
if (productionOrder.ProductionOrderStatus != SAPbobsCOM.BoProductionOrderStatusEnum.boposPlanned)
{
bChanged = true;
productionOrder.ProductionOrderStatus = SAPbobsCOM.BoProductionOrderStatusEnum.boposPlanned;
}
break;
case "RELEASED":
if (productionOrder.ProductionOrderStatus != SAPbobsCOM.BoProductionOrderStatusEnum.boposReleased)
{
bChanged = true;
productionOrder.ProductionOrderStatus = SAPbobsCOM.BoProductionOrderStatusEnum.boposReleased;
}
break;
case "FINISHED":
if (productionOrder.ProductionOrderStatus != SAPbobsCOM.BoProductionOrderStatusEnum.boposClosed)
{
bChanged = true;
productionOrder.ProductionOrderStatus = SAPbobsCOM.BoProductionOrderStatusEnum.boposClosed;
}
break;
case "CANCELLED":
if (productionOrder.ProductionOrderStatus != SAPbobsCOM.BoProductionOrderStatusEnum.boposCancelled)
{
bChanged = true;
productionOrder.ProductionOrderStatus = SAPbobsCOM.BoProductionOrderStatusEnum.boposCancelled;
}
break;
default:
break;
}

if (productionOrder.Remarks != process.UserKey + " " + process.Remarks)
{
bChanged = true;
productionOrder.Remarks = process.UserKey + " " + process.Remarks;
}

if (bChanged == true)
{
if (productionOrder.Update() != 0)
{
Console.WriteLine($"Error adding productionOrder: {company.GetLastErrorDescription()}");
}
}
}

}
}

DI API version 10.0 FP2105

Hy,

The created ProductionOrder's Type is always 'S' (bopotSpecial) but I set it as bopotStandard so it should be 'P' and the GetByKey() can't give back 'S' Type productionOrders.
Has it been fix in later versions, if yes which one?

Thanks

entry.title: How to attach a file in a purchase requisition in sap public cloud
entry.content:
Hello experts,

 this may be an easy question but,

i searched the Business Accelerator API but still have not found a way to do this.

I am looking to create a service in SAP CAP to upload pfd offers inside a created purchase requisition.

Can i use API_CV_ATTACHMENT_SRV, if so how? An example would be very apreciated.

 

Thank you for your answers.

entry.title: SAP API MANAGEMENT - cross reference transaction in S4HANA
entry.content:
Hello Community!

As a newcomer exploring the vast SAP jungle, I‚Äôm still learning to make sense of the many data streams flowing between its different technologies.

Here‚Äôs the scenario I‚Äôm wrestling with:

  • We have API Management (API M)

  • We have SAP S/4HANA ERP

  • The two are happily talking to each other

  • First touchpoint in S/4 is the SAP Gateway

  • We can see traffic flowing in Gateway Statistics

Now, the golden question (demanding a platinum answer) is:

Does a mechanism exist to generate a unique trace identifier whenever a transaction crosses from API M into S/4?

Or phrased differently:
 Is there a way to guarantee that 1 API call in API M corresponds exactly to 1 entry in SAP Gateway Stats?

Appreciate any guidance from the seasoned explorers out there.

Best regards,
Roger, over and out

Yann
(just a regular guy looking for a short moment of enlighten)

entry.title: Purchase order Percentage Price Condition on Purchase order Item
entry.content:
Hello there lovely SAP Community, 

 

id like to create Purchase orders with Custom Price Condition that is %-Based using the API: 

SAP_COM_0238
 
According to the WSDL the Structure is: 
 
V1:
<PriceCondition>
<!--Optional:-->
<ConditionType>?</ConditionType>
<!--Optional:-->
<ConditionAmount currencyCode="?">?</ConditionAmount>
</PriceCondition>
V2:
<PricingCondition>
<!--Optional:-->
<ConditionType>?</ConditionType>
<!--Optional:-->
<ConditionTypeName>?</ConditionTypeName>
<!--Optional:-->
<ConditionRateValue>?</ConditionRateValue>
<!--Optional:-->
<ConditionCurrency>?</ConditionCurrency>
<!--Optional:-->
<ConditionQuantity unitCode="?">?</ConditionQuantity>
</PricingCondition>
 
The Price Conditons should look like this: 
 

When i Create the PO with this Payload: (Version2) 

<ItemPrice>
<Amount currencyCode="DKK">100</Amount>
<BaseQuantity unitCode="PCE">1</BaseQuantity>
<!--Zero or more repetitions:-->
<PricingCondition>
<ConditionType>ZPB0</ConditionType>
<ConditionRateValue>100</ConditionRateValue>
<!--Optional:-->
<ConditionCurrency>EUR</ConditionCurrency>
<!--Optional:-->
<ConditionQuantity unitCode="PCE">1</ConditionQuantity>
</PricingCondition>
<PricingCondition>
<ConditionType>ZRL1</ConditionType>
<ConditionQuantity unitCode="%">10</ConditionQuantity>
<!--Optional:-->

</PricingCondition>
<PricingCondition>
<ConditionType>ZRZ1</ConditionType>
<ConditionQuantity unitCode="%">10</ConditionQuantity>
<!--Optional:-->
</PricingCondition>
<PricingCondition>
<ConditionType>ZRZ2</ConditionType>
<ConditionQuantity unitCode="%">10</ConditionQuantity>
<!--Optional:-->
<!-- <ConditionQuantity unitCode="P1">100</ConditionQuantity> -->
</PricingCondition>
<PricingCondition>
<ConditionType>ZRZ3</ConditionType>
<ConditionQuantity unitCode="%">10</ConditionQuantity>
<!--Optional:-->
</PricingCondition>
</ItemPrice>

 

The Result looks like this: 

 

 

 

Note that i dont have any %-value. 

How can i set the Price Condition to 10 % ? 

kind regards, 

Philipp

entry.title: OAuth2.0 Authentication Error When Setting Up Comm. Arrangement for an External API in Public Cloud
entry.content:
The objective is to consume the IRBM API (used for Malaysian e-invoicing) directly from S/4 Public Cloud.
And for that, we created a Communication Arrangement to establish the connection but we‚Äôre getting an authentication error when checking the connection:

Below are the setups for Communication Arrangement & System. For the Communication System, we specified the URL under Hostname and set Port as ‚Äú443‚Äù for HTTPS call.

Under the OAuth 2.0 Settings, the base url with ‚Äú/connect/token‚Äù are specified in order to get the token. 

NOTE: I have tried to remove the Authorization Endpoint and make it empty but it‚Äôs still throwing the same issue:

Also, an outbound user with OAuth2.0 authentication is set up to call the IRBM API from S/4 Public Cloud:

Here‚Äôs the setup for the Communication Arrangement where we specified an additional scope ‚ÄúInvoicing API‚Äù.

We‚Äôve tested this API in Postman, and it works fine as token can be retrieved successfully.

1 point to note, we also included the parameter grant_type during Postman testing but from my understanding this will be automatically handled by standard. But please let me know if this not the case or there‚Äôs a missing setup in the Communication System or Arrangement.

entry.title: Entity PRODUCTPURCHASEORDERTEXT is not maintainable in Product API error
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I am working with the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and trying to perform a POST operation using the Product (API_PRODUCT_2) API.
However, I‚Äôm receiving the following error response:

{
  "error": {
    "code": "CMD_PROD_RAP/011",
    "message": "Entity PRODUCTPURCHASEORDERTEXT is not maintainable",
    "target": "_ProductPurchaseOrderText(Product='102010000009',TextObjectType='BEST',Language='EN')",
    "details": [
      {
        "code": "CMD_PROD_RAP/011",
        "message": "Entity PRODUCTPROCUREMENT is not maintainable",
        "target": "_ProductProcurement"
      },
      {
        "code": "CMD_PROD_RAP/011",
        "message": "Entity PRODUCTPLANTPROCUREMENT is not maintainable",
        "target": "_ProductPlant(Product='102010000009',Plant='CN7A')/_ProductPlantProcurement"
      }
    ],
    "innererror": {
      "ErrorDetails": {
        "@SAP__common.Application": {
          "ComponentId": "LO-MD-MM",
          "ServiceRepository": "SRVD_A2X",
          "ServiceId": "API_PRODUCT_2",
          "ServiceVersion": "0001"
        },
        "@SAP__common.TransactionId": "86545C3DDA130010E0068E7D20C1703B",
        "@SAP__common.Timestamp": "20251009154237.258522",
        "@SAP__common.ErrorResolution": {
          "Analysis": "Use ADT feed reader 'SAP Gateway Error Log' or run transaction /IWFND/ERROR_LOG on SAP Gateway hub system and search for entries with the timestamp above for more details",
          "Note": "See SAP Note 1797736 for error analysis"
        }
      }
    }
  }
}

My Question:

  • Why are these entities (PRODUCTPURCHASEORDERTEXT, PRODUCTPROCUREMENT, PRODUCTPLANTPROCUREMENT) not maintainable through the post API?

  • Are there any restrictions in the Public Cloud Edition for maintaining these sub-entities via API?

  • Is there an alternative API or approach to update these product procurement or purchase order text details?

 

I‚Äôve already checked the payload structure and API reference documentation, and the JSON is valid. The base product entity is being read successfully ‚Äî the error occurs only during the POST operation.

Any insights or SAP Notes related to this behavior would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance,
Janarthanan R.

entry.title: Send default HTTP200 from SAP APIM
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We have a requirement where the API consumer is expecting a HTTP 200 response, irrespective of the backend response (error or success). We have exposed CPI iFlows through API proxies and the client is a Saas application connecting to APIM endpoints.

Please confirm if anyone has been able to achieve this functionality using SAP APIM policies, as we would like to avoid adding logic for this in iFlows.

 

Regards,

Diptee

entry.title: SAP BUILD Issue with Budget Approval Template ‚Äì Missing Field in POST api API_FINPLANNINGDATA_SRV
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

We‚Äôre currently working with the Budget Approval Template:
Workflow Budget Approval

At the end of the process, it performs a POST to the API_FINPLANNINGDATA_SRV service:
API_FINPLANNINGDATA_SRV

Initially, we faced an error related to the company field, which we resolved by following this note:
üîó SAP Note 3550655 - Company field issue

Now, we‚Äôre encountering a Budget error. After following this note and testing directly in Postman, the POST works correctly:
üîó SAP Note 3564398 - Budget error resolution

However, the issue is that the field PlanDataRplcScopeFieldsString is not available in the Build Action because it‚Äôs missing in the POST schema.
This means SAP Build currently doesn‚Äôt allow us to send this field, even though it‚Äôs required ‚Äî so it seems the POST definition and the template need to be updated by SAP.

At this point, it looks like my only workaround is to create a new custom action in Build Process Automation and manually include this field in the POST body.

Has anyone found another solution or workaround for this issue?

PS: The Build Automation template also has a mapping error when approval is not needed ‚Äî the POST mapping is incorrect in that case as well.

Thanks in advance for any insights!

entry.title: Unable to Access ‚ÄúDesign, Develop, and Manage APIs‚Äù After Completing Integration Suite Booster
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I‚Äôm currently going through the SAP Integration Suite onboarding tutorials. I successfully completed all the steps in the ‚ÄúEnable the SAP Integration Suite‚Äù booster, and the process completed with a success message.

However, when I moved to the next tutorial: ‚ÄúCreate an API Provider System‚Äù, I got stuck at Step 2, which asks to open the API Management Portal via ‚ÄúDesign, Develop, and Manage APIs‚Äù.

Here‚Äôs what I have already tried:

  • Verified Integration Suite is subscribed in my BTP subaccount

  • Tried re-opening via the ‚ÄúGo to Application‚Äù button

  • Cleared cache and tried Incognito mode

  • Waited for some time in case it was a delay

  • Checked tutorials again, but couldn't find what might be missing

I also tried searching the community and SAP Help, but couldn‚Äôt find a clear solution for this specific issue.

Has anyone faced a similar problem or can guide me on how to enable API Management properly so I can proceed with creating an API Provider?

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Connecting Non-SAP Systems with SAP BTP: APIs, Event Mesh & Integration Suite
entry.content:
Connecting Non-SAP Systems with SAP BTP: APIs, Event Mesh & Integration Suite

Integration is one of the top priorities for SAP customers in 2025. As hybrid IT landscapes grow , combining SAP S/4HANA, legacy systems, and modern SaaS, the SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) has become the central layer enabling these systems to talk to each other securely and in real time.

SAP‚Äôs Integration Suite, Event Mesh, and API Management together form the backbone of this connected ecosystem.

 

1. Why Integration Matters More Than Ever

Businesses rarely run fully on SAP alone. You might have Salesforce for CRM, Workday for HR, or custom-built logistics apps. These need to work seamlessly and tirelessly with SAP without faults, sharing customer data, triggering workflows, and ensuring real-time visibility across the value chain.

BTP helps unify all this through open connectors, APIs, and event-driven communication, without touching the core of SAP S/4HANA.

 

2. Integration Suite: The Foundation Layer

SAP Integration Suite offers a unified set of capabilities to design, manage, and monitor integrations between SAP and non-SAP systems.

Cloud Integration
For process-based, message-driven integration between SAP and non-SAP systems. It enables data flow through pre-built integration packages (for example, SAP ‚Üí Salesforce ‚Üí SAP), reducing development time.

API Management
Expose custom APIs from CAP-based apps or legacy systems, and consume REST APIs from third-party platforms. You can control access, apply rate limits, and ensure security via OAuth and API policies.

Integration Advisor
Suggests mappings and interface structures automatically, saving time and improving consistency during design.

Together, these tools simplify how business processes flow across a hybrid landscape.

 

3. Event Mesh: Making Systems Talk in Real Time

SAP Event Mesh introduces an event-driven architecture (EDA) , enabling systems to communicate through business events rather than constant API calls.

External systems can exchange data with SAP applications
When a customer creates an order in a non-SAP app, Event Mesh can instantly notify SAP S/4HANA or a CAP app to start fulfillment.

Processes stay synchronized in real time
Inventory changes, shipment updates, or status alerts are instantly propagated to every connected system , keeping everyone on the same page with standardized information and data.

You avoid modifying S/4HANA directly
By handling custom logic in BTP extensions and event subscribers, you reduce technical debt and simplify upgrades. The clean-core principle stays intact.

Event Mesh therefore acts as the ‚Äúnervous system‚Äù of the landscape, transmitting business signals instantly across applications.

 

4. APIs + Events = The Future of Integration

Modern integration combines APIs for control and events for awareness.
APIs handle structured, request-driven interactions (‚Äúget order details‚Äù), while events handle spontaneous updates (‚Äúorder created‚Äù).

Together, they enable loosely coupled architectures, where systems are connected, but not dependent.

 

5. Real-World Example: A Logistics Scenario

A German manufacturing company runs SAP S/4HANA for order processing, an on-premises warehouse management system (WMS), and a third-party shipping service that provides delivery tracking via REST APIs.

They use SAP BTP to integrate these three worlds, ensuring data consistency, real-time visibility, and a clean SAP core. Let‚Äôs see how the three pillars of integration make it work together.

 

Cloud Integration: The Process Connector

SAP Cloud Integration (part of Integration Suite) acts as the central traffic controller for data between S/4HANA and the warehouse system.

  • Whenever a sales order is created in S/4HANA, Cloud Integration picks up the outbound IDoc or OData event (for example, ‚ÄúSalesOrder.Created‚Äù).
  • It maps this order data into the format expected by the warehouse system, handling data transformations, enrichments, and protocol conversions (like IDoc ‚Üí REST).
  • The integration flow (iFlow) then securely transmits this data over HTTPS to the warehouse‚Äôs REST endpoint or message queue.
  • At the end of the day, the same flow also synchronizes stock levels or order confirmations back into S/4HANA.

This ensures both systems always have the same view of orders and inventory, without manual file transfers or custom scripts.

Result:
Process-based data exchange between SAP and non-SAP systems, fully automated and monitored from BTP.

 

Event Mesh: The Real-Time Messenger

While Cloud Integration handles batch or process-oriented data, Event Mesh ensures real-time responsiveness across the landscape.

  • When the warehouse system marks an order as ‚ÄúDelivered,‚Äù it publishes an event (for example, ‚ÄúDeliveryCreated‚Äù) to the SAP Event Mesh topic.
  • Event Mesh then pushes this event to all subscribed systems, such as the customer portal and CAP-based tracking app on BTP.
  • The subscriber apps instantly receive this update and can trigger follow-up actions, like sending a push notification or updating the customer‚Äôs order status on the web.

Unlike APIs that require constant polling, Event Mesh delivers updates asynchronously and only when needed, making the system more efficient and scalable.

Result:
Real-time synchronization without point-to-point dependencies, enabling instant reactions across systems.

 

API Management: The Secure Gateway

Now that multiple systems generate and consume data, API Management provides a unified and secure access layer for external consumption.

  • The company creates a custom ‚ÄúOrder Tracking‚Äù API that aggregates order and delivery data from both S/4HANA (via Cloud Integration) and the warehouse (via Event Mesh events).
  • This API is managed through SAP‚Äôs API Management service, where policies handle:
    • Security: OAuth 2.0, API keys, and JWT validation
    • Traffic Control: Rate limits, quota management
    • Monitoring: API usage analytics and latency reports
  • The customer portal or mobile app consumes this API securely, allowing users to track their orders end-to-end from a single interface.

Result:
A governed, standardized entry point for all external consumers hence reducing complexity while protecting sensitive business data.

 

6. Key Takeaway

Connecting SAP and non-SAP systems doesn‚Äôt have to mean complex middleware landscapes anymore.
With SAP BTP, Integration Suite, APIs, and Event Mesh provide a unified, scalable, and governed way to achieve cross-system connectivity, without sacrificing your clean-core principles.

Start with one process, make it event-driven, and expand from there.
Integration is no longer a project phase, it‚Äôs an ongoing capability that defines how modern enterprises operate.

 

#SAPBTP #IntegrationSuite #EventMesh #APIManagement #SAPArchitecture #CleanCore #SAPIntegration #EnterpriseArchitecture #DigitalTransformation #SAPDevelopers

entry.title: Update Account Assignment with Custom Price Conditions PO MMPUR SOAP API
entry.content:
Hello There SAP Community, 

 

We used to use the standard Price Conditions in SAP. Here we used the SOAP API MMPUR (https://myXXXXXX-api.s4hana.cloud.sap/sap/bc/srt/scs_ext/sap/mmpur_purchaseorderrequest_in) SAP_COM_0238 to Update the Account Assignment after a PO has been created with a other API. 

 

We used this payload to Update account Assigment M with Sales order references to existing Purchase orders. 

<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:proc="http://sap.com/xi/Procurement">
<soapenv:Header/>
   <soapenv:Body>
      <proc:PurchaseOrderRequest>
         <MessageHeader>
            <CreationDateTime>2018-02-27T12:00:00.1234567Z</CreationDateTime>    
            <SenderBusinessSystemID>0M5UKUQ</SenderBusinessSystemID>
            <ReferenceID schemeID="TDD" schemeAgencyID="Orbis" schemeAgencySchemeAgencyID="PON">123</ReferenceID>     
         </MessageHeader>
         <PurchaseOrder>
            <ActionCode>2</ActionCode>
            <PurchaseOrderID>4500000386</PurchaseOrderID>
                   <PurchaseOrderExternalReferenceID>4500000386</PurchaseOrderExternalReferenceID>      
            <SupplierParty>
               <Supplier>2</Supplier>
            </SupplierParty>
            <PurchaseOrderItem>
          <!--  <PurchaseOrderItemExternalRefID>MAT1</PurchaseOrderItemExternalRefID> :-->
               <!--Optional:-->
               <ActionCode>2</ActionCode>
               <!--Optional:-->
               <PurchaseOrderItemID>10</PurchaseOrderItemID>
               <!--Optional:-->
               <AccountAssignment>
                  <!--Optional:-->
                  <AccountAssignmentCategory>M</AccountAssignmentCategory>
                <!--Zero or more repetitions:-->
                  <AccountAssignmentLine>
                     <SalesOrder>55</SalesOrder>
                     <SalesOrderItem>000100</SalesOrderItem>  
                     <GLAccount>301500</GLAccount>                
                  </AccountAssignmentLine>
               </AccountAssignment>      
            </PurchaseOrderItem>
         </PurchaseOrder>
      </proc:PurchaseOrderRequest>
   </soapenv:Body>
</soapenv:Envelope>

 

This used to be Successfull.

 


Since we went for Custom Price Conditions and Calculation Shemas, it doesnt work anymore and we do get the Error Message:


Function/class MMPUR_AIF_PO_IN was not executed successfully
Purchase Order 4500000386 update failed
Purchase order still contains faulty items
Item 00010 (external ID ) is faulty. Please check the following messages:
Net price must be greater than 0

Even Sometimes we dont get any response at all. 

 

how can we Update the PO using MMPUR SOAP API? 

We need to use the SOAP API to be able to utilize the AIF Functionality in the System.
